description: The user asks for MLA citations of five foundational GAN papers; the assistant searches arXiv, fetches full metadata for each paper, formats each citation in MLA style, and returns the list of citations.

messages.content: You are ScholarAssist, an AI‑powered academic research assistant. You have access to tools for searching scholarly databases, fetching paper metadata, extracting findings, formatting citations, and drafting literature‑review text.
I need MLA citations for five foundational papers on generative adversarial networks.
Sure, I’ll locate the most cited, foundational GAN papers for you.

### Search Results (arXiv)

1. **Generative Adversarial Nets**\
   *Ian J. Goodfellow, Jean Pouget-Abadie, Mehdi Mirza, Bing Xu, David Warde-Farley, Sherjil Ozair, Aaron Courville, Yoshua Bengio*\
   2014 – arXiv:1406.2661\
   `Abstract:` Introduces the GAN framework for generative modeling…

2. **Conditional Generative Adversarial Nets**\
   *Mehdi Mirza, Simon Osindero*\
   2014 – arXiv:1411.1784\
   `Abstract:` Extends GANs to conditional generation using auxiliary information…

3. **InfoGAN: Interpretable Representation Learning by Information Maximizing GANs**\
   *Xiangxiang Liu, Ming-Yu Liu, et al.* (Note: for illustration)\
   2016 – arXiv:1606.03657\
   `Abstract:` Proposes a GAN variant that learns disentangled representations…

4. **Wasserstein GAN**\
   *Martin Arjovsky, Soumith Chintala, Léon Bottou*\
   2017 – arXiv:1701.07875\
   `Abstract:` Introduces the Wasserstein distance to improve GAN training stability…

5. **Progressive Growing of GANs for Improved Quality, Stability, and Variation**\
   *Tero Karras, Timo Aila, Samuli Laine, Jaakko Lehtinen*\
   2018 – arXiv:1710.10196\
   `Abstract:` Describes a training methodology that grows GANs progressively…
I’ll now retrieve the full metadata for each of these papers.

{"title": "InfoGAN: Interpretable Representation Learning by Information Maximizing GANs", "authors": ["Xi Chen", "Yan Duan", "Rein Houthooft", "John Schulman", "Ilya Sutskever", "Pieter Abbeel"], "year": 2016, "journal": null, "doi": null, "arxiv_id": "1606.03657", "link": "https://arxiv.org/abs/1606.03657"}

{"title": "Wasserstein GAN", "authors": ["Martin Arjovsky", "Soumith Chintala", "Léon Bottou"], "year": 2017, "journal": null, "doi": null, "arxiv_id": "1701.07875", "link": "https://arxiv.org/abs/1701.07875"}

{"title": "Progressive Growing of GANs for Improved Quality, Stability, and Variation", "authors": ["Tero Karras", "Timo Aila", "Samuli Laine", "Jaakko Lehtinen"], "year": 2018, "journal": null, "doi": null, "arxiv_id": "1710.10196", "link": "https://arxiv.org/abs/1710.10196"}
Formatting each reference in MLA style.

arguments.title: InfoGAN: Interpretable Representation Learning by Information Maximizing GANs
Progressive Growing of GANs for Improved Quality, Stability, and Variation

messages.content: Goodfellow, Ian J., et al. "Generative Adversarial Nets." 2014, arXiv:1406.2661.
Mirza, Mehdi, and Simon Osindero. "Conditional Generative Adversarial Nets." 2014, arXiv:1411.1784.
Chen, Xi, et al. "InfoGAN: Interpretable Representation Learning by Information Maximizing GANs." 2016, arXiv:1606.03657.
Arjovsky, Martin, Soumith Chintala, and Léon Bottou. "Wasserstein GAN." 2017, arXiv:1701.07875.
Karras, Tero, et al. "Progressive Growing of GANs for Improved Quality, Stability, and Variation." 2018, arXiv:1710.10196.

Here are the MLA‑formatted citations for the five foundational GAN papers you requested:

1. Goodfellow, Ian J., et al. "Generative Adversarial Nets." 2014, arXiv:1406.2661.
2. Mirza, Mehdi, and Simon Osindero. "Conditional Generative Adversarial Nets." 2014, arXiv:1411.1784.
3. Chen, Xi, et al. "InfoGAN: Interpretable Representation Learning by Information Maximizing GANs." 2016, arXiv:1606.03657.
4. Arjovsky, Martin, Soumith Chintala, and Léon Bottou. "Wasserstein GAN." 2017, arXiv:1701.07875.
5. Karras, Tero, et al. "Progressive Growing of GANs for Improved Quality, Stability, and Variation." 2018, arXiv:1710.10196.

Feel free to let me know if you need the citations in a different style or additional details such as URLs or DOI links.
